messages.message: Where can I see logs from inside a Celery task in image-tasks? I'm printing a bunch of error level log statements to help me debug something, but I don't see them printed out when I run `make build runlocal` nor do I see them in `worker-image-tasks.log`. I've tried setting pdb and rdb breakpoints as well, but neither seem to stop the flow of execution. Anyone have an idea as to what I might be doing wrong?
In which file did you add the logs?
Tasks.py in image-tasks. In the `redactor_run_on_page` Celery task specifically
are you sure you’re running code that will hit image-tasks?
I'm pretty sure. I'm running redactor on some documents and from my understanding that should hit it
hrm that should do it, is there another function in there that you’re equally confident will get hit? could try throwing in a `make clean build runlocal` for funsies

Any chance you’re adding them to the build/ files instead of src/? If you add them to build/, you shouldn’t run build (just make runlocal). That’s a mistake I’ve made in the past by command-clicking between references in vscode :blush:. If that’s not it, I’m happy to zoom and figure it out in the morning!
